title: Authorizes the issuance of distinctive license plates to severely disabled volunteer firefighters
summary: Authorizes the issuance of distinctive license plates to severely disabled volunteer firefighters; provides for an annual service charge of fifteen dollars to be charged for such plates.

       Introduced  by M. of A. MORELLE -- read once and referred to the Commit-
         tee on Transportation

       AN ACT to amend the vehicle and traffic law, in relation to  authorizing
         the issuance of distinctive license plates to severely disabled volun-
         teer firefighters

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1.  Subdivision 2 of section 404-a of the vehicle and  traffic
    2  law,  as  amended by chapter 191 of the laws of 1991, is amended to read
    3  as follows:
    4    2. Registration of vehicles owned by severely  disabled  persons.  The
    5  commissioner  shall  assign to such motor vehicles, including any van or
    6  pick-up truck used for transporting persons with disabilities  which  is
    7  not  used  for commercial purposes, owned by such persons, a distinctive
    8  number and issue and deliver in such  manner  as  the  commissioner  may
    9  select to the owner a certification of registration, in such form as the
   10  commissioner  shall  prescribe  and  two  number plates, called disabled
   11  person plates. Said disabled person plates shall conform to the require-
   12  ments of section four hundred  one  of  this  chapter,  but  shall  bear
   13  distinctive marks to distinguish them from number plates to be issued to
   14  other  persons,  qualifying under this chapter.  PROVIDED, HOWEVER, THAT
   15  NO SUCH PLATES SHALL BE ISSUED TO ANY PERSON TO  WHOM  THE  COMMISSIONER
   16  HAS  ISSUED  DISTINCTIVE  SEVERELY DISABLED VOLUNTEER FIREFIGHTER PLATES
   17  PURSUANT TO PARAGRAPH (B) OF SUBDIVISION ONE  OF  SECTION  FOUR  HUNDRED
   18  FOUR-X  OF THIS ARTICLE. The commissioner, in his OR HER discretion, may
   19  issue, for any registration year, only one plate as a set  for  a  motor
   20  vehicle,  in  which  event  a  set of disabled person plates for a motor
   21  vehicle shall consist of one plate. Where  a  severely  disabled  person
   22  owns  more  than one vehicle and such vehicle or vehicles is or are used
   23  by severely disabled members of the owner's family who reside  with  the
   24  owner,  the  commissioner  shall  issue one set of plates for each addi-

    4    S  2.  The  vehicle and traffic law is amended by adding a new section
    5  404-x to read as follows:
    6    S 404-X. DISTINCTIVE PLATES FOR SEVERELY DISABLED VOLUNTEER FIREFIGHT-
    7  ERS.  1. (A) ANY SEVERELY DISABLED  VOLUNTEER  FIREFIGHTER  SHALL,  UPON
    8  REQUEST, BE ISSUED A LICENSE PLATE BEARING THE WORDS "NEW YORK STATE" ON
    9  THE  TOP  OF  SAID  LICENSE PLATE AND "SEVERELY DISABLED VOLUNTEER FIRE-
   10  FIGHTER" ON THE BOTTOM OF SAID LICENSE PLATE.
   11    (B) ANY SEVERELY DISABLED VOLUNTEER FIREFIGHTER WHO HAS REGISTERED HIS
   12  OR HER MOTOR VEHICLE PURSUANT TO SECTION FOUR  HUNDRED  FOUR-A  OF  THIS
   13  ARTICLE  SHALL,  UPON  REQUEST,  BE  ISSUED  A LICENSE PLATE BEARING THE
   14  DISTINCTIVE MARKS AUTHORIZED BY SUCH SECTION FOUR HUNDRED FOUR-A AND THE
   15  WORDS "NEW YORK STATE" ON THE TOP OF THE  LICENSE  PLATE  AND  "SEVERELY
   16  DISABLED VOLUNTEER FIREFIGHTER" ON THE BOTTOM OF SAID LICENSE PLATE.
   17    (C) APPLICATION FOR SAID LICENSE PLATE SHALL BE FILED WITH THE COMMIS-
   18  SIONER  IN  SUCH FORM AND DETAIL AS THE COMMISSIONER SHALL PRESCRIBE AND
   19  SHALL BE VERIFIED ANNUALLY BY THE APPLICANT.
   20    2. THE DISTINCTIVE PLATE AUTHORIZED IN PARAGRAPH  (A)  OF  SUBDIVISION
   21  ONE  OF  THIS  SECTION  SHALL  BE ISSUED UPON PROOF, SATISFACTORY TO THE
   22  COMMISSIONER, THAT THE APPLICANT IS PRESENTLY  A  VOLUNTEER  FIREFIGHTER
   23  WHO  RECEIVES PERMANENT TOTAL DISABILITY BENEFITS UNDER SECTION EIGHT OF
   24  THE VOLUNTEER FIREFIGHTERS' BENEFIT LAW.  THE DISTINCTIVE PLATE  AUTHOR-
   25  IZED IN PARAGRAPH (B) OF SUBDIVISION ONE OF THIS SECTION SHALL BE ISSUED
   26  UPON  PROOF,  SATISFACTORY  TO  THE  COMMISSIONER, THAT THE APPLICANT IS
   27  PRESENTLY A SEVERELY DISABLED VOLUNTEER FIREFIGHTER WHO RECEIVES  PERMA-
   28  NENT  TOTAL  DISABILITY  BENEFITS  UNDER  SECTION EIGHT OF THE VOLUNTEER
   29  FIREFIGHTERS' BENEFIT LAW AND WHOSE DISABILITY QUALIFIES HIM OR HER AS A
   30  SEVERELY DISABLED PERSON WITHIN THE MEANING OF SUCH TERM AS  DEFINED  IN
   31  SUBDIVISION  FOUR OF SECTION FOUR HUNDRED FOUR-A OF THIS ARTICLE AND WHO
   32  HAS REGISTERED HIS OR HER MOTOR VEHICLE PURSUANT TO SECTION FOUR HUNDRED
   33  FOUR-A OF THIS ARTICLE.
   34    3. A DISTINCTIVE PLATE ISSUED PURSUANT TO THIS SECTION SHALL BE ISSUED
   35  IN THE SAME MANNER AS OTHER NUMBER PLATES UPON PAYMENT  OF  THE  REGULAR
   36  REGISTRATION FEE PRESCRIBED BY SECTION FOUR HUNDRED ONE OF THIS ARTICLE,
   37  PROVIDED,  HOWEVER,  THAT AN ADDITIONAL ANNUAL SERVICE CHARGE OF FIFTEEN
   38  DOLLARS SHALL BE CHARGED FOR SUCH PLATE.   SUCH  ANNUAL  SERVICE  CHARGE
   39  SHALL  BE  DEPOSITED  PURSUANT TO THE PROVISIONS OF SECTION FOUR HUNDRED
   40  FOUR-OO OF THIS ARTICLE, TO THE CREDIT OF THE DEPARTMENT OF MOTOR  VEHI-
   41  CLES   DISTINCTIVE   PLATE   DEVELOPMENT  FUND  ESTABLISHED  BY  SECTION
   42  NINETY-FIVE-G OF THE STATE  FINANCE  LAW  AND  SHALL  BE  USED  FOR  THE
   43  PRODUCTION,  DESIGN,  ADVERTISING  AND  MARKETING OF DISTINCTIVE LICENSE
   44  PLATES PURSUANT TO SECTION NINETY-FIVE-G OF THE STATE FINANCE LAW.
   45    S 3. This act shall take effect on the one hundred eightieth day after
   46  it shall have become a law, except that any rules and regulations neces-
   47  sary for the timely implementation of this act  on  its  effective  date
   48  shall be promulgated on or before such date.
